etymology.description: Phonetics: 爻(爻) + 六(六) -> 𦥑 added + semantic 子(子, "child") -> 學; 六 transformed into 冖(冖, "cover") + hands 𦥑 around 爻 connected with 冖
etymology.interpretation: The character originally combined phonetic components 爻 and 六 with 子 to depict the concept of studying or learning, symbolized by a child learning in a roofed place. Over time, the component 六 evolved into 冖, and the surrounding elements merged to form the modern character.
etymology.simplification: 学 is simplified by removing部分 like 子(子) (zǐ, "child") and simplifying 爻(爻) (yáo, "two crossing lines") into simpler strokes under 冖(冖, "cover").

examples.chinese: 我每天都努力学习(我每天都努力學習)。
他喜欢在课堂上学知识(他喜歡在課堂上學知識)，并分享所学(並分享所學)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xǐhuān zài kètáng shàng xué zhīshì, bìng fēnxiǎng suǒ xué.
examples.english: He likes to acquire knowledge in class and share what he has learned.

examples.chinese: 科学的发展离不开学(科學的發展離不開學)，每个人都应不断学(每個人都應不斷學)。
examples.pinyin: Kēxué de fāzhǎn lí bùkāi xué, měi gèrén dōu yīng búduàn xué.
examples.english: The development of science cannot do without learning, and everyone should keep studying.
